fields.description:
When resetting the origin of a repository the initial edit dialog completes, but pressing the "OK" button does nothing. It does update the repository origin but it is not shown. The "OK" button becomes non-operative.
The "Cancel" button works so you can exit the Settings dialog.
However, when this procedure is repeated for many projects/repositories SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Resetting of origin eventually causes crash.

fields.description: Not sure how exactly SourceTree is performing the submodule removal, but there's a [thread of conversations around it on Stackoverflow|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1260748/how-do-i-remove-a-git-submodule] and when I do that by hand it works fine.
fields.summary: Deleting submodule causes tree to be inconsistent and client to stop rendering remaining submodules

fields.description:
As detailed in [1], SourceTree does not properly support files whose name include special characters, like the ones detailed on Atlassian Answers (Catalan's "ç" and Spanish "ñ").

For English users is easy to say it's not recommended to use them, but for most non-English projects this can be a real issue if they include files generated, for example, by end-users.

As it's the case of many non-English projects, I've prioritized it as a "Blocker" issue (in fact, I currently cannot merge form SourceTree a branch which includes many of them.

I've attached some images:
- The "importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logroño.xls" was detected as to be deleted by SourceTree.
- If tried to stage it, the following error message appeared:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree rm -q -f -- xms/framework/architecture/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logroño.xls 
fatal: pathspec 'xms/framework/architecture/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logroño.xls' did not match any files
Completed with errors, see above

- If I try to re-create it by adding it to the browser, it appears both as new and modified (see the attached "st.png").

- If I go to the command line, I can see the following (please, notice how the special character is represented by git as "\303\"):

[code]
# On branch feature/GC-1895
# Your branch is ahead of 'bitbucket/feature/GC-1895' by 4 commits.
#
# Changes not staged for commit:
#   (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed)
#   (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
#
#	modified:   "importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_ACoru\303\261a.xls"
#	modified:   "importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logro\303\261o.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetQualitativeValues_LAE_ACoru\303\261a.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetQualitativeValues_LAE_Logro\303\261o.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetRisks_LAE_ACoru\303\261a.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetRisks_LAE_Logro\303\261o.xls"
#
# Untracked files:
#   (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)
#
#	"importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_ACorun\314\203a.xls"
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
MacBook-Pro-de-Oscar-Bou-Bou:resources oscarboubou$ 


[code]

Thanks for your comprehension!






[1] https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/321885/git-sourcetree-on-osx-and-?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fanswers.atlassian.com%2Fquestions%2F321885%2Fgit-sourcetree-on-osx-and-&application=acac
fields.summary: Not supported files with special characters (despite being supported by GIT and OS X)

fields.description:
I raised a question here in case I was missing something:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/14190877/can-repository-browser-show-the-repo-path-by-default

Just to summarize I will repost here:

I am using SourceTree 2.0.5.2 on OS X and am wondering if there is any way for the Repository Browser to show the full path of the local repository by default? Basically some neat way of showing the Quicklook info in the regular listing. My workflow generally has numerous copies of the same repo so I can collect needed repos for certain issues so I have a structure like:

~/projects/Bug1234/reponame1
~/projects/Bug1234/reponame2
~/projects/Bug1234/reponame3
 
~/projects/Bug456/reponame1
~/projects/Bug456/reponame2
~/projects/Bug1456/reponame3
 
If I were to add these repos to Repository Browser it would just show up like
 
reponame1
reponame2
reponame3
reponame1
reponame2
reponame3
 
And to figure out which repo is with which bug I have to quicklook them so generally I am clearing out the RB between working on stuff. I imagine there's a better way to organize this all but this sounds like it would be a cool optional setting to have if it does not exist yet.
fields.summary: Would be nice to have Repository Browser show a path by default for local repositories

fields.description:
*STEPS TO REPRODUCE:*
1) Create branch on the remote in some folder (ex. features/test1)
2) Checkout branch to your local repo (tracked branch)
3) Delete branch remotely/ via command line (Not from Sourcetree)

Branches still shows up in the remote section. Clicking "Fetch from <Branch Namr>" in context menu, or in menu "Repository -> Refresh Remote Status" doesn't update the remote list on Sourcetree
fields.summary: Remote not updated neither via "Fetch form <branch name>" or "Refresh Remote Status" if  branches in folders (gitflow) are deleted remotely

fields.description:
A user said, "We have multiple branch histories and, more importantly, several subtrees (incl. an upstream Pressflow Drupal distro, several modules, etc) which each have a long commit history. It's difficult to see where things connect with more than a few history lines on the screen, esp. if there is a long list of commits (e.g. in ancestor order). 
What I am thinking would be useful is the ability to "toggle" visibility of these history lines by branch, or perhaps even by an unnamed subtree merge.

I would like to toggle visibility of subsets of branches, not just view a single branch in isolation with the existing functionality"

!toggle.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Feature Request: The ability to "toggle" visibility of these history lines by branch, or perhaps even by an unnamed subtree merge.

fields.description: The app is extremely slow, unresponsive, as if some heavy process was going on inside it the whole time.
fields.summary: SourceTree is unusable slow after update to 2.0.5.2

fields.description: 't Would be nice if I could click somewhere, and open the repo website on BitBucket or GitHub in a browser.
fields.summary: Click to GitHub or BitBucket

fields.description:
As of now, SourceTree freezes whenever it has NFS mounted repositories. 

It would be best if SourceTree can handle those repositories smoothly, as some Git clients/products has no such limitations.
fields.summary: Request: SourceTree to run NFS mounted repositories smoothly

fields.description: When selecting one submodule and deleting it via the context menu, all other submodules on the repo will be deleted as well.
fields.summary: Deleting one submodule will delete ALL submodules on Sourcetree
Calculate "N commits behind" using `--first-parent` flag

fields.description:
A user reported, 

"The problem is that whenever I add something to the "Staged Files", the focus of the File Status view shifts to show that staged file. This becomes an issue when: 

1) I am adding multiple but not all chunks of a file-to make this work, every time I add a chunk I have to relocate the file I am adding from and then the place in the file where I left off

2) when I am adding several files from a dirty workspace with a lot of edited files

In this case I have to scroll back through the "Staged Files" and "Unstaged Files" to find my old scroll position and continue evaluating the remaining unstaged files."

!1.png|thumbnail!

!2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unstaged file's scroll position refreshes when a file is staged.

fields.description:
In the branches view, at file list below the graph, the file selections and scrolling position auto refreshes on random time. Even if in the middle of selecting files, everything just randomly being refreshed. Sometimes it refreshes in a few seconds, sometimes it refreshes in minutes.

Related to this SourceTree Windows issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-3060
fields.summary: File selections and its scroll position in branches view fully refreshes midway

fields.description:
On Source Tree 2.0.5.2 for OSX, if my Repository Browser has no bookmarks, I have the option to scan a directory to locate repositories to add to Stash. 

I cannot find a method to scan a directory if I already have bookmarks. The only way I've found to scan a directory is to delete all your bookmarks and then rescan, picking a directory that is a parent to all the repositories of interest.

This feels like a missing feature and the "Scan a directory" button should be available as part of the "+ New Repository" menu. If this feature is already present, it's location is unintuitive.
fields.summary: Better Surface Scanning a Directory for New Repositories

fields.description:
In the log view, I can select 'Current branch'. As soon as I select a different branch however, this jumps back to 'All branches'. See attached screenshots, which show the behavior: in the first screenshot, I have selected 'Current branch'. In the second screenshot, I have selected a different branch (note: I clicked it _once_, so it's just selected for the log viewer, I haven't actually doubleclicked to switch branches yet), the Log view jumps back to 'All branches' view. 

This sounds minor but it's an extremely annoying behavior as it makes quickly browsing through branches to get a sense of what got merged where really difficult.

Can this be fixed to keep the current selection (in my case 'Current branch') the default for all branches and repos? 

I do notice that if I immediately doubleclick, rather than first single-clicking, it does remain in 'Current branch' status.
fields.summary: Log view always goes back to 'All Branches' when selecting different branch

fields.description:
Hi, thanks for the free tool.

If I make a git rebase, and there is a conflict, the repo is in 'limbo' until I resolve the conflict AND FINISH THE REBASE. But after resolving the conflict and just by looking at SourceTree it all appears normal. In fact I have to go to the CLI to do {code}git rebase --continue{code} (or abort or whatever). If I need to go to the CLI it means SourceTree is failing.

Suggestion:
* color code the UI, or somehow visually indicate that the rebase is not complete
* add rebase continue / abort / skip button(s)
* disable all other buttons

Thanks
fields.summary: Better feedback when rebase --continue is needed

fields.description:
Consider:

1. Do a commit with push. The push fails because somebody else has done a push.

2. SourceTree leaves up the git error report, so it's obvious what the reason is.

3. Upon clearing that report, SourceTree puts up another alert saying the commit succeeded but the push failed, which is redundant.

4. Now we need to pull, make sure the pull worked, and then push.

Ideally, the second alert would be removed completely, or augmented with an additional option to automatically pull and commit if no conflicts were detected.
fields.summary: Fewer clicks to re-pull after failed push

fields.description:
"Mar 16, 2015, 11:23 AM" is a long date string and there is no apparent way to make this shorter. Some possible acceptance criteria:
* For today's commits, just show me the time (11:23 AM)
* For this year's commits, omit the year (Mar 16, 11:23 AM)
* For this year's commits prior to today, I might not care about the time, so give me the option to show only the date (Mar 16)
* For last year's commits, I'm unlikely to care about the time, so show only the date and year (Mar 16, 2014)
* Allow shorter date formats, for example, 3/16/15, 11:23 AM)
fields.summary: Allow Short/Relative Date/Time Display

fields.description:
After I scroll down in the log view I no longer can see which branch the commits belong to.

But on the BitBucket website every commit indicates which branch or branches the commit is a member of. That is very useful to me.
fields.summary: Add Branches column to the Log view (like on BitBucket)

fields.description:
Here is my initial report:

Hi.
I've started using the "Rebase children of <commit> interactively..." and I have UI advises that should help most users:
1/ The displayed sheet is quite good, as you can amend each commit. Nothing to say here, easy to select each commit you want and click OK
2/ There is the biggest problem: the sheet disappears and.... "then what?". As a noob to intermediate git user, I don't know what to do next!!!! I'm pretty sure most noobs are lost there because they think the interactive rebase process is over!
Note that, as most users, I did not open/expand the "direct git output" in the previous sheet, that clearly explains what we should do next: abort rebase, continue rebase and another command I forgot.
So I strongly suggest displaying some sort of " thick colored status bar" at the top of the window (just below the NSToolbar) stating "you're currently in an interactive git rebase process. Do the following actions to continue:", with either the name of the action you can find in the "Actions" menu, or even better, with some buttons (in the thick bar) to actually do the rebase abort, rebase continue.... I would tremendously help users understand that the interactive rebase process is not over! they would immediately understand that they have actions to make (abort, continue....) to return in a "normal" state.
Thanks for listening.
BTW, SourceTree is great. I can't imagine using Git without it now. Except for interactive rebase which is more "managed" and has more indications on what's next using the CLI!
fields.summary: Indicate at the top of the main window that we're in a git (interactive) rebase process

fields.description:
A customer said: "The name of this action 'discard file', always requires me to think if that is what I want to do. 'discard changes' might be more straight forward." I think his comment makes sense:

!discard.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Request to change "Discard File" option name, to "Discard Changes"

fields.description:
Since a recent update (a few months) I have been getting index.lock errors like below when I perform one operation (pull, commit, merge) then wait a few seconds after it appears complete (but there is still a spinner in the upper portion of the log view) then do a second operation (even add a change to the index). Frequently I have to have sourcetree fetch then wait for all the spinners to stop to get sourcetree to perform any git operations again. This is horrendous for my productivity since I like to view diffs and stage hunks in the UI but each change requires this long delay.

For full disclosure I have 2 clones of the same stash repo and usually have a sourcetree window open for each. I also have a fetch all bash script I run frequently to get all changes on the repo in all my clones (fetch clone 1, fetch with tags clone 1, fetch clone 2, fetch with tags clone 2). Running or not running this script has not seemed to affect sourcetree's behavior and I have been seriously considering not using or recommending it since it performance overall and this issue mean it is nearly unusable now.

"fatal: Unable to create '/Users/robertm/stash/monoceros_MERGE/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue."
fields.summary: Must wait a long time after operation to avoid index.lock file conflict

fields.description:
I want to configure "extended integration" for repositories on GitHub Enterprise, to be able to create Pull Request directly form SourceTree.
Currently 'GitHub' option only supports standard GitHub.
fields.summary: Support for GitHub Enterprise

fields.description:
Hey

I am trying to finding source tree linux setup but it seems, it is only available for windows and Mac.

 I know this is not appropriate project to request this feature but is there any specific reason that is not available or may be, I am not aware of the way to deploy it in Linux.
fields.summary: SourceTree linux desktop

fields.description:
The {{gitk}} program that ships with Brew's git (it's a tcl/tk app) has the very pleasing effect of color coding the two "Parent" sha hyperlinks so one can tell which is which. A picture, 1000 words, etc.

Now their version actually just uses red and blue, all the time, but it would be so very helpful to have the hyperlink color correspond to the color of the incoming branch line. The labels are correctly color coded, so I'm hoping this request won't be intractable.
fields.summary: color code the parent sha hyperlink in a merge commit to indicate branch

fields.description: If a user has multiple remotes configured for a repository, it would be useful to disable certain remotes (say from other developers) so that branches from those do not clutter the view. When the user wants to checkout a certain branch from a disabled remote, they would re-enable the remote before checking out the branch. By default, all remotes should be enabled.
fields.summary: Hide all branches for a remote repository

fields.description:
While developing, we often change a few files, just for the development environment of this feature. We don't want to commit those changes.

We don't want to add them to .gitignore: these files are to be in the repo, and are maintained. We just don't want to push these particular local changes.

It would be nice to flag such files for a while, to have them "out of the way". and to avoid committing them by mistake.

(In WebStorm, I often create a special Change List for that, but a real feature could be even nicer - possibly bound to the branch, as if often depends on working on a feature, and everybody uses feature branches anyway ... or should ...)
fields.summary: Hide changes to files for while

fields.description:
In contrast to Windows, the history list doesn't update in SourceTree for Mac instateneously. No worries.

But as a Mac and iPad user I have grown accustomed to "pulling down the list" to force an update.

That isn't realised in SourceTree now, and would be nice.

I found out that "fetching" does the trick, but the "pull down" would be consistent and nice to have.
fields.summary: Refresh on pull down
Automatic JIRA issue in first line of commit message

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Rename a git remote of a repo manually - E.g: Rename the git remote via command line/terminal
2. Open the repo on Sourcetree, the 'Remotes' section on the left panel on Sourcetree has been updated the new remote name, however on the Commit History panel, the old remote name is still shown (refresh, restart the app)
fields.summary: Repository remote name does not reload on commit history view after changing the name manually

fields.description:
You know what would be nice?
Change lists, like I am used to have in WebStorm.
fields.summary: Change lists

fields.description:
Hello. I'm lawrence.

I'd like to see my commit at github homepage.
Probably commit log link is "http://PROJECT_LINK(;except for ".git")/commit/COMMIT_LOG"

For example, My project's origin is "https://github.com/playframework/playframework.git"
And commit is "c7b09520f68fdd268a9ed19d739f5734e7d81ce0", then commit log link is
"https://github.com/playframework/playframework/commit/c7b09520f68fdd268a9ed19d739f5734e7d81ce0"

Thank you for reading.
fields.summary: link to github in commit log layer

fields.description:
The rename icon (dark gray arrow) has a badly chosen color, as dark grey gives no contrast when the files are selected. - see atteched two images: One can not see the arrow on dark blue selected lines.
Can you change the color of the renamed files icons?
fields.summary: Color of "Renamed" icon invisible after selection

fields.description:
On the Mac, the user (or other programs) can add icons to folders. They are invisible files, with the beautiful name "Icon^M". The last character is a control character.

Most people don't want them in a git repo.

We've dealt with this with svn. We want to ignore them, and probably globally. Adding "Icon^M" to the global .gitignore file should do the trick. But that is difficult with that control character. On the internet we can find ways to get it done.

But it is such a bore.

It would be nice if SourceTree would provide some special assistance in the SourceTree "Ignore" dialog for this.
fields.summary: Please help us deal with ignoring Icon^M

fields.description:
Currently, $REPO, $FILE, and $SHA are available in the parameters field for a Custom Action. I'd like to request the addition of a $BRANCH variable that would expand to the name of the current branch.

Use case: I push to a Gerrit code review server with multiple branches. With $BRANCH, I can specify the parameters for my git invocation as "push gerrit $SHA:refs/for/$BRANCH" instead of requiring a different custom action for every branch I want to push to.

This should be trivial to implement. Suggest using `git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD` for the value of $BRANCH which gives the branch name if on a branch, or "HEAD" when on a detached HEAD.
fields.summary: Requesting $BRANCH variable in Custom Actions parameters

fields.description:
My use case is perhaps an atypical usage of stash-- I prefer to delete my stashes explicitly.  If I stashed something I want it sticking around until I'm sure I'm done with it.  When re-applying a stash, by default SourceTree asks to delete it.  Occasionally I forget to unclick it (even though that is what I'm doing every time I see the dialog).   It's annoying to have to remember to unclick it and when I forget to re-create the stash.

I'd like to change the default behavior (to make the confirmation not auto-check "delete after applying"), but there is no preference to do so.

This ticket would therefore be to add a preference that would allow the confirmation dialog when applying stashes to not automatically default to checked to delete, but to default to unchecked.
fields.summary: Preference to leave "delete after applying" as unchecked when applying stashes

fields.description:
I would like to have the ability to hide/ignore few (not all) branches from either remote or local or both in sourcetree history.

I mean suppose I have branches A, B, C, D and E on my remote repository. We should be able to tell sourcetree to show only the A an E branches in commit history always.

It would also be desirable, if sourcetree never performs fetch in other (ignored) branches (B, C, D).

Please note that showing remote branch along the local copies is often important, therefore hiding all remote branch is not a solution.
fields.summary: Ignore or hide specific remote branches in sourcetree

fields.description: http://screencast.com/t/mZzjpXtfT
fields.summary: The settings not to rebase instead of merging are ignored

fields.description:
Bypassing commit hooks in Git should be avoided. Currently if you check the option, it remains checked after committing. If you forget to uncheck it, you're in an unsafe world.

SourceTree should ideally reset the option after each commit, forcing you to check it again if you're doing consecutive commits that require bypassing. 

Not sure if this also applies to Mercurial or Windows.
fields.summary: Reset "Bypass commit hooks" after commit

fields.description:
If I un-check "Commit merge immediately" and "Create a commit even if merge resolved via fast-forward" is check-on, a commit is performed always. It looks like this check box is simply ignored.

In my current case, I know that this won't be a fast-forward merge. This has happened to me numerous times, not just this case, and on more than one repo.

I've turned on the command log when performing this action:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree merge --no-ff origin/mydevbranch
fields.summary: Unable to skip commit on merge

fields.description: Some spammy branches get in the way of viewing a repo in SourceTree, for example a CI tool like Travis can create hundreds of commits to a repo's gh-pages branch. It would be great to be able to hide these branches from view.
fields.summary: Hide branch

fields.description:
In the browse/bookmarks window its great how it shows a project's logo if that project is hosted from BitBucket. It would be great if SourceTree could also pull logos/project avatars from Atlasssian Stash!
For users with lots of projects in stash it would make it much faster to browse for the repo your are looking for.
fields.summary: Add Stash Logos to SourceTree

fields.description:
After selecting multiple rows in the bookmarks window, I would like to be able to create a new group contains all the selected items. Finder works like this.

The current right click contextual items contains "New Group", but the newly created group wouldn't include all the previously selected items.
fields.summary: Add option to "Create New Group From Selection"

fields.description: When viewing a commit graph, one can rarely see branch labels associated with the various colored dots/lines in the graph.  This makes it difficult to trace a particular commit to the branch it is on.  Having a dot in the sidebar next to the branch name that matches the dot color in the commit graph would be very helpful . . . and easy to implement!
fields.summary: Decorate sidebar branch names with the same color commit dot from the commit graph
When using submodules, it would be helpful to display the current branch

fields.description: I had a check out of a reasonably large GIT repo (~2GB) and the little progress bar got completely full while the on disk copy of the repo was still at 1GB. It would be good if I could see the log output here so that I could get an idea of what is going on.
fields.summary: Expose log view for initial repository check out

fields.description:
Hi guys, 

This article needs an update: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=269981808

:)
fields.summary: Update documentation: SourceTree a Free Git and Mercurial GUI (Mac OSX)

fields.description: Currently, Sourcetree supports staging parts of files that has been added using the git --add command. But does not support files that has been added with the flag intent-to-add, the ability to support that would be useful in some scenarios.
fields.summary: Add the ability to stage parts and lines of a new file

fields.description: The drop down to filter which branch information to display defaults to "All Branches". It would be nice to be able to select the default. I never use "All branches", but I do use "Current Branch".
fields.summary: Remember my branch settings

fields.description: I would like an option to automatically move versions of files that are being reset to the trash. This is the default for TortoiseSVN and TortoiseGit, which I have used previously. This is helpful to be able to temporarily revert to the previous version of a file when testing code, and quickly undo by restoring the file, if desired.
fields.summary: Option to automatically move reset/reverted files to trash

fields.description:
When I attempt to checkout a branch in SourceTree initiated from Stash, a checkout dialog will be automatically populated with the remote and local branches, but when I proceed I will get a message like:

{code}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin 
error: Ref refs/remotes/origin/feature/TH-3054-update-other-projects is at 853adcad75a339b42b638843aae888b715d69b44 but expected 9abb83f87343bf5d22418aac6400a7fbcdf1506d
From https://aaa.bbb.com/stash/scm/th/those
 ! 9abb83f..853adca  feature/TH-3054-update-other-projects -> origin/feature/TH-3054-update-other-projects  (unable to update local ref)
 * [new branch]      feature/TH-3099-rem-record-methods -> origin/feature/TH-3099-rem-record-methods
 * [new branch]      feature/TH-3102-schema-extension-id -> origin/feature/TH-3102-schema-extension-id
 * [new branch]      integration/TH-3099-rem-record-methods -> origin/integration/TH-3099-rem-record-methods
Completed with errors, see above
{code}

When I hide the message and try again, I don't get the error and the branch is available.
fields.summary: Often get an error when checking out from remote branch, works the 2nd time

fields.description: It would be useful to have custom remote hosted accounts (may not be easy though!). For example, we use SCM Manager and it would be really useful to be able to connect to it and list its repos rather than adding one-by-one. Any chance?
fields.summary: Custom hosted account

fields.description:
"Discard file" on a directory in the staged pane also affects its files in the unstaged pane. This is unexpected behavior since the two panes are visually separated.

This might show up most if you have a partially staged, partially unstaged file. Lets say there's a few other staged files in the same directory. I decide that I need to discard all of the staged parts, so I use Discard file on the directory. I go back to that partially staged/unstaged file and can't find the unstaged work that I had done before.

Workaround: Don't Discard file on directories. I changed from Fluid staging to No staging to reduce the likelihood of this.
fields.summary: "Discard file" on directories discards both staged and unstaged

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In the {{Log}} view, if a filename contains a special character (i.e. é or á), then the diff will not display, and will instead display a blank white area.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file in your repository, and add a special character to the filename. For example {{tést.txt}}.
# Commit the file to the git repository.
# Go to the {{Log}} view in SourceTree and select the commit.

The diff for that file with the filename containing a special character will appear blank. See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Diff Shows Blank in "Log" View for Filenames Containing Special Characters

fields.description: Selecting a group of repositories and executing cmd+r (refresh remote status) should refresh it for all repositories in that group (and all subgroups, tree-wise) without the need to select each and everyone (and/or open it)
fields.summary: Refresh remote status of all repositories

fields.description:
In a Mercurial repository previously initialized for hgflow, SourceTree v2.0.5.2 fails to recognize the the existing {{.hgflow}} file.

When the Hg Flow button is pressed, SourceTree offers to initialize the repo with a new flow config file named {{.flow}}.

The command-line {{hg flow}} works fine with the  existing {{.hgflow}} file.
fields.summary: Hg Flow fails to recognize existing `.hgflow`

fields.description: I'd like to be able to get a simple list of commits without caring about the merge history. This is basically the equivalent of using "git log --no-merges --topo-order". Topo-order is already supported by SourceTree, but not no-merges. Any chance of getting this added as an option?
fields.summary: Add support for --no-merges

fields.description:
When you open Sourcetree for the first time, you see the screen as in the screenshot.
The sentence "Sleur en pleur een map of" is informal and impolite way of saying "Drag and drop a folder or". A better translation would be "Sleep een map hierheen of "
fields.summary: Drag And Drop Dutch Translation is very informal

fields.description:
In the latest stable version of SourceTree "refs/heads" is automatically added into command with push to remote and not switch off.
When I need push to gerrit so I need remote path without heads.

In version 2.4.0 it works. 

new:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags origin refs/heads/refs/for/2.1:refs/heads/refs/for/2.1 

old (required):
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags origin refs/heads/2.1:refs/for/2.1
fields.summary: Automatically added refs/heads

fields.description:
*To reproduce:*

- Make few commits and push the master branch to remote origin, and make sure your local Branch is tracking origin/master.
- Make few more commits but do not push them to remote.
- Try to make an interactive rebase from Repository > Interactive rebase menu.
- Now remove the remote.
- Try the interactive rebase again. From the Repository > Interactive rebase menu. You will get an empty window error.

!rebase.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Empty  Interactive rebase window if there is no remote tracking for repository

fields.description: A lot of times I want to commit every change I made, so it is inconvenient for me to first stage everything and then press commit. Pressing commit should show a small message box asking me if I want to stage everything and commit. It would be great if you could implement this!
fields.summary: allow to auto-stage everything when pressing commit with nothing staged

fields.description: Would it be possible to have a keyboard shortcut to toggle this checkbox on/off, or a way to navigate to it via the keyboard once you've finished writing your commit message?
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for "Push changes immediately to X" when committing

fields.description:
When relaunching SourceTree, it should resume in the same Fullscreen Mode state that it was in when SourceTree quit. This follows the functionality of OS X Resume. This should also work for when SourceTree crashes.

Alt+Cmd+Q should void this action (Quit and Close all Windows). Disabling app Resume from System Preferences > General should also disable this.
fields.summary: Restarting SourceTree does not save Fullscreen Mode

fields.description:
When using the shelf/unshelfe function, the tick in the unshelfe box to delete the shelf should not be checked by default. 

Would be great, if there is any possibility to set the default in the settings or change the box to an dropdown which uses the last value.
fields.summary: Change the unshelf delete checkbox default value / make it editable

fields.description: When "split view staging" is used and sort order "sorted by checked/unchecked", when trying to select files for staging, files do not get selected and nothing gets staged.
fields.summary: GIT Staging/commit is broken when "split view staging" is used and sort order "sorted by checked/unchecked"

fields.description: In the newest version 2.0.5.2 of Sourcetree for Mac, the functionality Stage hunk and Stage line generates an error message: apply patch failed.
fields.summary: Stage hunk, Stage line functionality is broken

fields.description:
Please look at this ticket here for the description of the problem.
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/12258328/answers/12258746/comments/12260517
fields.summary: SourceTree to inform (properly) when a file from the remote repo has been deleted

fields.description:
In version 2.0.4 the git push command looks like (omit some options):
git push -v origin master:refs/for/master

In 2.0.5, it looks like:
git push -v origin refs/heads/master:refs/heads/refs/for/master,
which is treated by Gerrit as a request to push directly to that branch. Users who do not have permission to push to refs/heads or create branches (refs/heads/refs/for/* usually doesn't exist) get an error and are not able to push their patchset.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.0.5 does not work with Gerrit

fields.description:
Is there any possible we could exchange the layout of commits view and diff view.
I need more space to view diff, but the biggest is displaying history commits, I have to click "external diff" everytime.
Wish I have make myself clear, I am editing on my phone, maybe someday I will  comment a photo.
Any reply is gratitude.
fields.summary: relayout

fields.description: Sourcetree is not able to show diffs on files located in a repo folder if the repo folder name contains special characters. (E.g: Pokémon)
fields.summary: SourceTree cannot show diffs if repo folder contains special characters

fields.description: The “Show in Finder” button and menu item don't do anything.
fields.summary: “Show in Finder” not working

fields.description:
When a commit is highlighted on the history list, when scrolling through a long list of commits, the commit history window will reset its scroll position to ensure that the currently-selected commit is visible in the window, meaning that the user has now lost the current scroll position, and must start scrolling down again to find whatever the user was looking for

*STEPS TO REPRODUCE:*
1. Open a Git repo in Source tree that contains a long history of commits.
2. Select a commit in the history list.
3. Scroll down a ways so that the selected commit is off screen.
4. Switch window focus to your favourite text editor. Make a change to a file currently tracked by the repo and save.
5. Switch window focus back to SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree frequently resets scroll position

fields.description: I created a new file in a git repository, but did not stage it.  Chose "Create Patch" with "Patch From Working Copy" and explicitly selected the new file in "Unstaged files".  The file was not included in the patch.
fields.summary: Creating patch from git working copy ignores unstaged new files

fields.description:
In the Log view (command-2), there's a big horizontal bar in the middle to split the window between the log (top) and the files changed by the selected log entry (bottom).

SourceTree allows moving this splitter up and down by dragging the very top edge of the bar. It's an area about 5 pixels tall. It does the job, but it's hard to hit.

Xcode has a similar horizontal bar to separate the text editor (top) from the assistant area (bottom), and you can drag any point on the bar to resize it. The target area is about 30 pixels tall.

It would be great if SourceTree allows dragging anywhere in the empty space on the bar, like Xcode does.
fields.summary: Bigger drag target for the splitter in Log view

fields.description: Today SourceTree has been crashing after a couple minutes of usage. This is not atypical and happens when simply clicking in the GUI.
fields.summary: Crashes very frequently.

fields.description:
When a Custom Action is run, it doesn't result in a Command History entry.   
It would improve integration if performing a Custom Action can add a line to Command History, with the name of the Custom Action, the command, and any standard output of the action.
fields.summary: Improve Custom Actions integration by adding an output to Command History

fields.description:
When Pull is pressed, it performs git fetch, followed by git pull.
Since git pull implies git fetch followed by merge/rebase, it results in telling git to fetch+fetch+merge/rebase. 

Removing either the initial git fetch, or changing the git pull command to git merge/rebase would improve performance and responsiveness as communications to a server can be slow.

Ideally, the Pull button should only result in a single fetch operation.
fields.summary: Change the Pull button to perform fetch+merge/rebase instead of fetch+pull
SSH doesn't work with non-weak ciphers

fields.description:
Here are the report steps:
1. Launch Sourcetree.
2. Open a new project window.
3. Observe the description column is cut off.

Reproduction Rate : 3/3
fields.summary: Description is cut off when opening a new source tree window, have to manually drag around to expand the description

fields.description:
Hi, I keep getting the following error message after I delete a branch. 

'git log' failed with code 128:'fatal: bad revision 'feature/deleted_branch' 

It appears at least once immediately after I delete the branch, as well as every time I checkout any branch, and every time the app checks whether files have changed or not.

Interestingly enough, this issue rarely occurs while I'm using git-flow to merge branches (which has the option to delete the finished feature after merging).

The frequency of the issue seems to vary a bit between osx 10.8 and 10.9. On 10.8 the issue only appears after I commit to the branch I delete, however on 10.9 it does it even regardless of if I've committed anything or not.

The only way I've found to fix the issue is restarting the app. So it's got to be something going on with the app rather than a git issue.
fields.summary: After branch is deleted error 128 appears [fixed in 2.5 please close this issue]

fields.description:
Add a special event for option clicking push in the tool bar. It should perform a push to the tracked remotes. It should work just like a commit that has the checkbox "Push changes immediately to origin/master".

Why?
I often commit multiple different commits at a time, and would like to push to Origin/Master only on my last commit. 

I never need to watch this commit happen, yet there's no option for a silent push. 

Double down and add a checkbox for "Push to origin on focus lost" somewhere.
fields.summary: Toolbar: Option + Click on "Push" Should perform a silent push

fields.description: When trying to log in on Sourcetree registration, if password used contains the quote character ("), authorisation will fail and the error message: "Authorisation Failed, Parser failed with error" will show up
fields.summary: Password containing quote-characters (") doesn't work in Sourcetree Registration

fields.description: Often when I press commit I will start typing my message immediately, not realizing for a few seconds that for some reason focus has gone to the search box instead of the commit message box. When I do a commit the keyboard focus should move to the commit message text box automatically.
fields.summary: Pressing Commit should put focus in the commit message field

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
1) Have an unstaged file on the unstaged container and highlight the file
2) Double click on the 'Staged files' container

If the option "Stage files on double click" is checked, the file will be added into the 'Staged' container.

If the option is unchecked, the file will be opened instead
fields.summary: Highlighting unstaged file & double clicking in `Staged files` container will open up the unstaged file

fields.description:
On the main page you have to scroll to be able to see the signup button in the iframe, as per screenshot attached.

!stapp.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Signup Iframe doesn't get rendered fully

fields.description:
I have --no-ff set in my global Git configuration (because I prefer that method of merging). But when I integrate changes from upstream branches I need to be able to do a "merge --ff upstream/branch". Unless I'm missing something, the current SourceTree UI doesn't accommodate this workflow (even though it supports git-flow, which is odd).

I'd like to see a "Merge (FF) ..." entry in the context menu, and wherever else in the UI it makes sense.
fields.summary: Merge with an explicit "--ff"

fields.description: Like it's done by [stash|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/168906/stash-git-whitespace-line-endings] and [github|https://github.com/blog/967-github-secrets] with {{?w=1}} ...
fields.summary: Option to hide whitespace only changes in diff view

fields.description: Crash on changing branch, merge, fetch, etc.
fields.summary: Crash on changing branch, merge, fetch, etc.

fields.description:
Multiple unnecessary error dialogs when you have a repo open in SourceTree and you delete it locally outside of SourceTree.

Steps to reproduce...
# Run the following in a terminal
{code}
cd ~/Developer
mkdir test-sourcetree-delete
cd test-sourcetree-delete/
git init
touch some-file.txt
git add some-file.txt
git commit -m "added a sample file"
{code}
# Open SourceTree and view the new repo
# Leaving the repo window open in SourceTree, delete the local repo in terminal
{code}
cd ~/Developer
rm -rf test-sourcetree-delete/
{code}

Depending on where you are in the SourceTree interface, after deleting the local repo (behind SourceTree's back) you will receive one or more of the following error dialogs.
!Screen Shot 2015-01-19 at 10.24.52 AM.png!

It would be nice for SourceTree to detect that the repo was deleted and present the option to "remap" the bookmark, delete the bookmark or close the window.
fields.summary: Detect local repo deletion better when the repo is open in SourceTree

fields.description:
When attempting to *Repository* >> *Shelve Change*, geting the following error:

{noformat}
hg shelve -y --git --force wip 
hg shelve: option --git not recognized
hg shelve [OPTION]... [FILE]...
...
{noformat}

Have otherwise performed the workaround given in SRCTREE-2891.

Have tried using a _System Mercurial_ of 3.2.4 with similar result.

Current workaround is to use patches or "hg shelve" from command line but this defeats the purpose of having SoureTree.

I should add, this problem showed up when I upgraded to v2.0.4. The problem persists even after downgrading to v2.0.3.
fields.summary: Unable to shelve changes in v2.0.4

fields.description: I think it would be a good idea to have a little "refresh remotes" button in the sidebar. When working on a repo I often have the outdated information about remote branches (like old hotfix branches being displayed) which cannot be manually refreshed. The automatic refresh does not seem to work.
fields.summary: Button to refresh remotes

fields.description:
Using SourceTree's internal version of _Mercurial_ results in an error because the extension *hgsubersion* cannot be loaded.  This results in the repository being inaccessible to SourceTree.

The workaround is to disable the *hgsubversion* extension under _Preferences / Mercurial_, then restart SourceTree.  Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Internal Mercurial extension hgsubversion broken

fields.description: Under _Preferences/Mercurial_, if one tries to _"Use System Mercurial"_, the file dialogue box does not let you select any files.  All files appeared greyed-out / non-selectable.
fields.summary: Cannot select system version of Hg. All files greyed-out

fields.description: We have encountered several instances when using SourceTree where inexperienced GIT users have gotten into situations they they do not understand and are hard to reverse engineer. It would be useful to log all of the GIT operations and output so that forensics could be performed both for issue resolution and training purposes.
fields.summary: Log all GIT operations

fields.description: When attempting to create a pull request for a branch that is not available on the origin repository, sourcetree silently fails. It be would expected that an error message stating that the branch does not exist remotely.
fields.summary: no error message when trying to create pull request on branch not pushed to remote

fields.description:
Dynamic link problem when opening a git project using the internal git version (see WORKAROUND below) :

'git log' failed with code 5:'dyld: lazy symbol binding failed: Symbol not found: ___strlcpy_chk
  Referenced from: /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/bin/git
  Expected in: /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib

dyld: Symbol not found: ___strlcpy_chk
  Referenced from: /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/bin/git
  Expected in: /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib
'

WORKAROUND:
SourceTree keeps running, so you can
  - open the preferences
  - in the 'git' pane, select 'use the system version of Git ' (translated from my French version), and choose /usr/bin/git
   - quit SourceTree and relaunch
fields.summary: git builtin version crashes

fields.description:
In the repository browser, when I mark the final row (the repository at the end of the list) it becomes completely covered by a blue bar. No text visible.

I use folders in the repo browser, in case that makes a difference
fields.summary: Final row in repo browser not visible when marked

fields.description: When i open my project with enabled mercurial extension 'hgsubversion' i got error message (look at attachment), if i disable it all working fine.
fields.summary: Mercurial extension hgsubversion problem

fields.description:
I shelved some changes on the command line using Hg v3.2.3. The changes are shown with the command {{hg shelve -l}}

The changes do not appear in the SHELVED section in SourceTree's source list (left side of my working copy window).
fields.summary: Shelved changes do not appear in SHELVED section of source list

fields.description:
Most of the pop-up alert dialogs should be replaced by non intrusive UI messages, ones that do not require user intervention.

Reference:
* http://www.forward.com.au/javaProgramming/javaGuiTips/dialogBoxes.html
* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dialog_box
* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/152938/when-is-modal-ui-acceptable
fields.summary: Modal popup dialogs should be replaced with less-intrusive UI messages
